intro: Stemonurus parviflorus, commonly known as the small-flowered stemonurus, is a flowering plant native to southern China and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30-60 centimeters, with slender stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and often emit a mild, spicy scent when crushed. Stemonurus parviflorus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks.
